intro: Scleranthus corrigioleflorus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sand-rocket, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and pungent odor. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and thrives in open habitats such as coastal dunes and disturbed ground. Its leaves are narrow and often have a glandular surface, while its flowers are usually pink or purple. Scleranthus corrigioleflorus is an annual plant with a short life cycle, completing its development within a single growing season.
